summary: The Closing Bribery Loopholes Act (H.R. 3741) aims to amend Title 18 of the United States Code to clarify the definition of 'official act' in relation to bribery of public officials and witnesses. The bill specifies what actions constitute an official act, including a single act, multiple acts, or a course of conduct, regardless of its outcome. This clarification is intended to close existing loopholes in bribery laws.
